description_txt: stated on April 7, 2014 in in a broadcast of Fox News' "Hannity":
quote_txt: A North Carolina study proves that "probably over a million people voted twice in (the 2012) election."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2014 in comments on MSNBC's "Morning Joe":
quote_txt: Before "our last three presidents, you have to go back to the 1800s, early 1800s to find three presidents in a row being consecutively re-elected."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2014 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: When Republicans last controlled the presidency and Congress, "the number of people on food stamps (and) the number of people in low-income housing went through the roof."

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2014 in comments on CNN:
quote_txt: "Young women today in metropolitan areas" who are childless and single are out-earning childless, single young males.

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2014 in a discussion on Fox News' "The Five":
quote_txt: "Of all the jobs President Obama claims to have created since he started, only 38.5 percent are women. So 61.5 percent have gone to men."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2014 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Before Congress, (Tom) Cotton got paid handsomely working for insurance companies and corporate interests."

description_txt: stated on April 3, 2014 in a broadcast of "The Five" on Fox News:
quote_txt: "The Koch brothers are one of the biggest polluters in the country."

description_txt: stated on April 3, 2014 in in an "El Nuevo Herald" editorial:
quote_txt: "Seniors enrolled in Medicare Advantage are going to see an average premium increase between $50 and $90 per month."

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2014 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: Says Charlie Crist supports "cuts to the Medicare Advantage program."

description_txt: stated on March 25, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Reps. Phil Gingrey and Jack Kingston have "even changed votes to what I voted, multiple times."

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2014 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Drone technology now allows an individual to be recorded in their homes by drones as small as birds and immediately uploaded to the internet."

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2014 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says the Koch brothers "funded the fight to let flood insurance premiums soar ... Now they’re spending millions to buy a Senate seat for Bill Cassidy so he can fight for them."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2014 in a meme on Twitter:
quote_txt: "Who will raising the minimum wage actually help? … More than half work full-time. The average worker is 35 years old."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2014 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Charlie Crist "raised taxes in 2009 and won't rule out raising taxes again."

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2014 in a news story:
quote_txt: Says he was the only statewide elected official to speak in favor of a federal guest worker plan at the 2012 Republican Party of Texas convention.

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2014 in a speech:
quote_txt: "In order to pass the CRCT in Georgia, you simply have to get half of the answers correct."

description_txt: stated on March 27, 2014 in a radio interview.:
quote_txt: Says the Medicaid fraud rate in Virginia was "fact-checked" and found to be "0.47 percent."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2014 in an online petition:
quote_txt: "Greg Abbott said it would be a ‘waste’ to expand pre-k to all Texas children."

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2014 in a public address:
quote_txt: "More than 3 million young adults ... have gained insurance under (the Affordable Care Act) by staying on their family’s plan."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2014 in comments on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "When people enter the service, there’s not a mental health evaluation."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2014 in comments on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "The numbers of people that support Obamacare and like it have been steadily dropping."

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: A poll taken "a few months ago" found "70 percent approval or higher" for the Act 10 collective bargaining law.

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2014 in a speech during a rally at the Rhode Island state house:
quote_txt: "By a two-to-one margin, Rhode Islanders want to ban assault weapons and we have a very small percentage of gun owners in this state, less than 13 percent."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • April 6, 2014

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2014 in a tweet.:
quote_txt: Gov. McAuliffe's budget would "raid school, other $$ 4 Obamacare in VA."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2014 in a public presentation:
quote_txt: "We’ve dedicated more money from (Washington County’s) transportation budget to bike and ped projects under my watch than at any time in the history of Washington County."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2014 in a chain email:
quote_txt: Says Michelle Obama waved "red communist flags" on her trip to China.

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2014 in a chain email:
quote_txt: This is the first time since World War II that five nuclear-powered aircraft carriers were docked together.

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2014 in an op-ed for the "Wall Street Journal.":
quote_txt: "EPA officials have commended (Koch Industries) for our ‘commitment to a cleaner environment’ and called us ‘a model for other companies.’ "

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2014 in an interview on "The O'Reilly Factor":
quote_txt: "If you want out of the individual mandate... all you have to do now is tick off the box that says 'hardship' and you're out."

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2014 in an interview on Fox's 'Hannity':
quote_txt: Says the goal of the Affordable Care Act was to get 30 million people insured, but it only got 7 million.
